title: mlcp imports aggregate with uri_id could lose data
description:
Found by investigating regression of bug19151. It happens intermittently.

There supposed to be 1162 docs loaded, however about 300 deleted fragments are found after ingestion. Apparently, duplicate uris are generated.

running following shell command: /space2/qa/mlcp/runmlcp.sh /space2/qa -options_file /space2/qa/mlcp/data/agg/input-files/bug19151.txt
stderr/out from shell cmd: /space2/qa/mlcp/data/agg/input-files/bug19151_tmp.txt /space2/qa/mlcp/data/agg/input-files/bug19151.txt
stderr/out from shell cmd: 2013-02-27
stderr/out from shell cmd: drwxrwxrwx 5 ali ali 4096 2013-02-27 14:08:25.234544706 -0800 marklogic-contentpump
stderr/out from shell cmd: directory exists
stderr/out from shell cmd: however, it was created today
stderr/out from shell cmd: data/xml/bigdata directory exists.
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 DEBUG contentpump.ContentPump: Command: IMPORT
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 DEBUG contentpump.ContentPump: Arguments: -username admin -password admin -host ali.marklogic.com -port 5275 -mode local -input_file_path /space2/qa/mlcp/data/agg/bug19151 -input_file_type aggregates -aggregate_uri_id ArticleTitle -output_uri_replace \[,'',\],'',:,'' 
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 DEBUG contentpump.ContentPump: Running in: localmode
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner: Content type: XML
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 INFO jvm.JvmMetrics: Initializing JVM Metrics with processName=JobTracker, sessionId=
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 DEBUG contentpump.LocalJobRunner: Thread pool size: 4
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 INFO input.FileInputFormat: Total input paths to process : 1
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 DEBUG contentpump.LocalJobRunner: Thread Count for Split#0 : 4
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:24 DEBUG contentpump.MultithreadedMapper: Running with 4 threads
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:25 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner:  completed 0%
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:26 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner:  completed 26%
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:27 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner:  completed 63%
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:28 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner:  completed 92%
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:31 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner:  completed 100%
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:31 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner: com.marklogic.contentpump.ContentPumpStats: 
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:31 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner: ATTEMPTED_INPUT_RECORD_COUNT: 1177
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:31 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner: SKIPPED_INPUT_RECORD_COUNT: 0
stderr/out from shell cmd: 13/02/27 14:36:31 INFO contentpump.LocalJobRunner: Total execution time: 7 sec
stderr/out from shell cmd: removing temp file /space2/qa/mlcp/data/agg/input-files/bug19151_tmp.txt

By enabling debug log level, it shows MultithreadedMapper is used. By setting thread_count to 1 (use DocumentMapper) seems to make the problem goes away. I suspect it is a bug in MultithreadedMapper.

changeHistory.comment: As it causes losing data, it is worth fixing in 7.0-ea1.

The bug is a synchronization issue of multi-threads in MultithreadedMapper. 
The fix is to synchronize the following three operations as a whole so that these three operations do not get overlapped: nextKeyValue, getCurrentKey, getCurrentValue.

After fixing the  above, data loss still exists.

meanwhile, find XDMP-DEADLOCK on ErrorLog:

013-03-01 00:33:08.317 Debug: Retrying XDBCRequestTask::handleConnection 1 /insert because XDMP-DEADLOCK: Deadlock detected locking test2 Education%20and%20primary%20health%20care.

Note that "Education%20and%20primary%20health%20care." is the expected duplicate uri generated by mlcp because there are two ArticleTitle with text node as Education%20and%20primary%20health%20care.

When this DEADLOCK happens, data loss is observed.

Is it a bug in server where two documents with exactly the same uri try to insert at the same time?

in ML 5, XDMP-DEADLOCK is logged at Notice level log:
2013-03-01 10:49:57.839 Notice: QAxdbcServer: XDMP-DEADLOCK: Deadlock detected locking test5-1 Education%20and%20primary%20health%20care.1

And XCC gets this and shows a warning:
13/03/01 10:49:58 WARN mapreduce.ContentWriter: XDMP-DEADLOCK: Deadlock detected locking test5-1 Education%20and%20primary%20health%20care.1

In ML7-ea1, XDMP-DEADLOCK is logged at DEBUG level log:
013-03-01 00:33:08.317 Debug: Retrying XDBCRequestTask::handleConnection 1 /insert because XDMP-DEADLOCK: Deadlock detected locking test2 Education%20and%20primary%20health%20care.
 
And XCC/mlcp doesn't show any error or warning.

In both ML 5 and ML 7, data is lost whenever XDMP-DEADLOCK happens.
This is reproduced in the latest ML 7 build 7.0-ea1_20130301.
This bug should be server bug because the server should throw the XDMP-DEADLOCK at Notice level so that XCC can catch it.

Let me rephrase it: 
the server should throw the deadlock exception so that XCC can catch it and log XDMP-DEADLOCK at Notice level.
A separate bug is filed: Bug 20995.
Please keep an eye on bug19151 in regression.
